Class DBConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • DBConnection

  • public class DBConnection
extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DBConnection.TableNames
      Enum TableNames Desc: Used to specify which table a query/insertion/deletion is targeting so the program can properly output the query results

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBConnection

        public DBConnection(java.lang.String connectonInfo)
        Parameters:
        connectionInfo - The URL of the SQL database, including the username and password

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes all connections. Helps prevent the SQL database from getting mad about too many connections

      • query

        public void query(java.lang.String query,
         DBConnection.TableNames select)
        Outputs a formatted table of the query.
        Parameters:
        query - The full SQL query (include SELECT _ FROM _ WHERE _ ...)
        select - The name of the table, comes from the enum DBConnection.TableNames

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String query,
          DBConnection.TableNames select)
        Outputs a formatted table of the query.
        Parameters:
        query - The full SQL query (include INSERT INTO [tablename] VALUES(...))
        select - The name of the table, comes from the enum DBConnection.TableNames

      • getData

        public java.sql.ResultSet getData(java.lang.String query)
        Returns the ResultSet of a given query.
        Parameters:
        query - The query being sent to the database
        Returns:
        The ResultSet returned by the query

      • getPrice

        public int getPrice(java.lang.String itemID)
        Special helper for a specific query to help with transaction calculations
        Parameters:
        itemID - The itemID of the item you need the price for
        Returns:
        The price of the item with the specified itemID

      • getLastID

        public java.lang.String getLastID(DBConnection.TableNames t)
        Returns the last inserted ID in a given table

        Note: for tables with no table-specific ID (Like Has or Contains), nothing is returned

        Parameters:
        t - A TableNames object specifying the table to get the last inserted ID from
        Returns:
        The last inserted ID in the given table. Returns null for tables that have no table-specific ID

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String query,
          DBConnection.TableNames select)
        Delete a tuple from a given table. Will output all tuples affected before removing them from the table.
        Parameters:
        query - The full SQL query (DELETE FROM [tablename] WHERE [expression])
        select - The TableNames object of the specified table

      • modifyCustomers

        public void modifyCustomers(java.lang.String customerID,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String phone,
                   java.lang.String address,
                   java.lang.String email,
                   java.lang.String discount)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Function to print the result of a modification on a tuple in table Customers. Only send values that are changed. Any value that is not changed should be passed as null
        Parameters:
        customerID - The given customer's ID. Must not be null
        name - The customer's name. If null, it remains unchanged.
        phone - The customer's phone number. If null, it remains unchanged.
        address - The customer's address. If null, it remains unchanged.
        email - The customer's email. If null, it remains unchanged.
        discount - The customer's discount. If null, it remains unchanged.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the TableNames given in the query function points to the wrong table

      • modifyEmployees

        public void modifyEmployees(java.lang.String employeeID,
                   java.lang.String ssn,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String rank,
                   java.lang.String wage,
                   java.lang.String locationNum)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Function to print the result of a modification on a tuple in table Employees. Only send values that are changed. Any value that is not changed should be passed as null, other than the employeeID. The employeeID must not be null.
        Parameters:
        employeeID - The given employee's ID. Must not be null
        ssn - The employee's social security number. If null, it remains unchanged.
        phone - The employee's name. If null, it remains unchanged.
        address - The employee's rank. If null, it remains unchanged.
        email - The employee's wage. If null, it remains unchanged.
        discount - The employee's location number. If null, it remains unchanged.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the TableNames given in the query function points to the wrong table

      • modifyInventory

        public void modifyInventory(java.lang.String itemID,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String type,
                   java.lang.String price)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Function to print the result of a modification on a tuple in table Inventory. Only send values that are changed. Any value that is not changed should be passed as null, other than the itemID. The itemID must not be null.
        Parameters:
        itemID - The given item's ID. Must not be null
        name - The item's name. If null, it remains unchanged.
        type - The item's type. If null, it remains unchanged.
        price - The item's price. If null, it remains unchanged.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the TableNames given in the query function points to the wrong table

      • modifyStore

        public void modifyStore(java.lang.String locationNum,
               java.lang.String address,
               java.lang.String manager)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Function to print the result of a modification on a tuple in table Stores. Only send values that are changed. Any value that is not changed should be passed as null, other than the locationNum. The itemID must not be null.
        Parameters:
        locationNum - The given store's ID. Must not be null
        address - The store's address. If null, it remains unchanged.
        manager - The store's general manager. If null, it remains unchanged.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the TableNames given in the query function points to the wrong table

      • modifyTransaction

        public void modifyTransaction(java.lang.String transactionID,
                     java.lang.String total,
                     java.lang.String customerID,
                     java.lang.String locationNum)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Function to print the result of a modification on a tuple in table Transactions. Only send values that are changed. Any value that is not changed should be passed as null, other than the transactionID. The transactionID must not be null.
        Parameters:
        transactionID - The given transaction's ID. Must not be null
        total - The total cost of the transaction. If null, it remains unchanged.
        customerID - The Id of the customer involved in the transaction. If null, it remains unchanged.
        locationNum - The store location number where the transaction occurred.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the TableNames given in the query function points to the wrong table
